org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Interface DirectedGraph.ChildrenBuilder<N>

  • Type Parameters:
    N - the type of the node. The nodes are distinguished based on their equals.
    Enclosing class:
    DirectedGraph<N>

    public static interface DirectedGraph.ChildrenBuilder<N>
    Defines a builder to add children to a particular node in the graph.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class may not be used from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    DirectedGraph.Builder.addNode

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void addChild(N child)
      Adds a new child to the associated node.
      void addChild(N child, java.util.function.Consumer<? super DirectedGraph.ChildrenBuilder<N>> grandChildSpec)
      Adds a new child to the associated node and continues with adding children to the newly added child node.
      default void addChildren(java.util.Collection<? extends N> children)
      Adds new children to the associated node.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        void addChild(N child,
              java.util.function.Consumer<? super DirectedGraph.ChildrenBuilder<N>> grandChildSpec)
        Adds a new child to the associated node and continues with adding children to the newly added child node.
        Parameters:
        child - the new child to be added to the associated node. This argument cannot be null.
        grandChildSpec - the action which can add child nodes to the newly added child node. This argument cannot be null.

      • addChildren

        default void addChildren(java.util.Collection<? extends N> children)
        Adds new children to the associated node.

        The default implementation repeatedly calls the one argument addChild method for all the elements in the children collection.

        Parameters:
        children - the children to be added to the associated node. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. However, it can be empty, in which case, this method does effectively nothing.

      • addChild

        default void addChild(N child)
        Adds a new child to the associated node.

        The default implementation calls the two argument addChild method} with an action doing nothing.

        Parameters:
        child - the new child to be added to the associated node. This argument cannot be null.
